title: Quality of Life fix for Kalista - disable Martial Poise dash on nearby targets
body:
When you click on an enemy who is within attack range, do not make Kalista dash towards them.

The reason for this is simple: it makes micromanagement with Kalista work more like micromanagement with every other champion in the game.

With other champions: If you want to move somewhere, you click on the ground. If you click on an enemy out of range, you move into range and start attacking. If you click on an enemy who is in range, *you attack them*.
With Kalista's Martial Poise: If you want to move somewhere, you click on the ground. If you click on an enemy out of range, you move into range and start attacking. If you click on an enemy who is in range, *you dash towards them*.

This is a bad thing. It would still be possible to attack and dash towards an enemy, but it would no longer be possible to do so by accident just by trying to autoattack them.

replies.body: Her passive is like a free flash. If someone flashes away she'll just need to use her passive on minions to catch up. Her Q range i find very broken.
Safe to say these mechanics are way over my head :/.
Why are you not using the martial poise, and why are you clicking on the enemy with the passive in effect?

Because sometimes you want to change who you are autoattacking - to last hit a minion, for example. Martial Poise makes the timing for this much more finicky, because the command for "attack this target" is the same as the command for "dash towards this target".

As I said, there would be nothing stopping you using Martial Poise the same way you do now to pursue an enemy - all you would need to do is click on the ground near the enemy instead of clicking on the enemy, the same way you would for any other champion.
If you always use the passive, then it's not a problem {{summoner:13}}
Always using the passive *is* the problem. It should not be necessary to fight the interface to do something as simple as *not* dashing towards the enemy.

No forgetting to use the passive after an auto is the problem.

If your passive is always used, then you won't dash to the enemy will you?
